oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Selected synthetic strategies to spirocyclics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
DEB, AC
LAHIRI, K
MANIVANNAN, E
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: spiro compounds
metathesis
diels-alder reactions
domino reactions
suzuki coupling
radical reactions
ring closure
ring-closing metathesis
cyclic 1-amino-1-carboxylic acids

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The design and synthesis of spirocycles is a challenging task because it involves the creation of a quaternary center, which itself is considered to be one of the most difficult tasks among synthetic transformations. Some recent approaches based on metathesis, cycloaddition and transition-metal-mediated transformations to spirocycles are described here.
